rooms.Name: Aisle to the Satellite Stage
rooms.Description:
Here you are, dead smack in the middle of 70,000 U2 fans, all pushing
and groping each other just to get a little peek at Bono. To the north, you
see the Satellite Stage where the band performs the second half of their 
Zoo TV show.

rooms.Name: Satellite Stage
rooms.Description:
You're now standing on the Satellite Stage, where the band performs such
great songs as Angel of Harlem, and Satellite of Love. How many people in
that crowd you fought through would just KILL to get to where you are right
now. To the north, you can see the main stage, and to the south, you can
see that mass of chaos called "fans".

rooms.Name: Main Stage
rooms.Description:
This is the main stage, where 1,200 tons of equipment, 3 miles of cable,
and 1 million watts power the spectacle that you see unraveling before you.
Looking around, you see TV screens to the north, east, and west playing
movies, and looking up, you notice a smaller stage above the main stage.
You think to yourself..."How many stages do these guys need, anyways?"

rooms.Name: The West Stage
rooms.Description:
You are at the west part of the main stage surrounded by all the
sights and sounds of ZooTV.  Further to the north you can hear the banging
and crashing of Larry Mullen Jr's drums.

rooms.Name: A TV screen showing the Rocky Horror Picture Show.
rooms.Description:
Sitting here in technicolor(tm) splendor, is the gateway to the
mansion of Dr. Frank N. Furter. Do you dare risk the the peril of androids
and transvestite aliens? I hope so, because one step to the north, is your
ticket to sex, drugs, violence, and yes, even Meatloaf.

rooms.Name: The North Stage
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the north end of the stage by Larry Mullen Junior's
huge drum set.  The crisp snare sounds of Sunday Bloody Sunday fill the 
air around you.  It's as if you've been taken back to the war-torn streets
of West Belfast.

rooms.Name: Backstage at ZooTV
rooms.Description:
You are behind the main ZooTV stage.  Behind the world of TV screens
CDI, DVE, and the miracle of chromakey are the band members' dressing
rooms.  Do you dare go any farther?

rooms.Name: Bono's Dressing Room
rooms.Description:
You are in the middle of Bono's dressing room.  THe small cubicle is
all covered in gold glitter and filled with several very bright lights.
On the north wall of the room is a small make-up table with a large
mirror.  Bono is sitting in front of the mirror and having his make-up
applied.  The only question is...whose picture is that on the wall?

rooms.Name: Start of the Meaning of Your Life
rooms.Description:
You're in a damp and wet red room.  Wait a second...this must be the
womb from which you'll spring forth and begin your life.  What awaits
You out there in the cruel world only time will tell!

rooms.Name: The Fetus Frightening Room
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a room filled with all sorts of expensive equipment
and doctors.  This is where it all begins...life.  Oh...look over there is
the machine that goes PING!  That's the most expensive machine in the whole
hospital!  It costs over three hundred million pounds!  Aren't you lucky?

rooms.Name: The Meaning of Life Part II:  The Third World
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of the street in a middle class working
neighbourhood of East London.  There are literally hundreds of kids dancing
around the street and singing "Every Sperm is Sacred."  Look at all those
Catholics filling up the world with all those children.

rooms.Name: Adam Clayton's Dressing Room
rooms.Description:
You stand here in the middle of Adam Clayton's dressing room.  There's
a spare bass guitar sitting over in the corner begging to be played.  I'm
sure Adam wouldn't notice...would he?

rooms.Name: The Dining Room
rooms.Description:
We came here to discuss Eddie.  Well, actually you came here to eat Eddie,
but that's a rather tender subject.  Another slice anyone?  Mmmmmm.....

rooms.Name: The Kitchen
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the centre of the castle's rather spacious kitchen.
You're really not sure that you want to know what gets cooked in here, but
I have a feeling you're going to find out like it or not!

rooms.Name: The Criminologist's Suite
rooms.Description:
I would like, if I may, to take you, on a strange journey.  It seemed a
fairly ordinary night when Brad Majors and his Finacee Janet Weiss, two
young...oh stuff it Chucky.  The man who sits behind the desk in this room
has absolutely no neck.  He has no neck!

rooms.Name: The Parking Lot
rooms.Description:
What more is there to say?  This is the large parking lot where you can
drive up to see the Rocky Horror Picture Show.  You see the large screen
to the south, to the north is the entrance to the castle.  You see a small
church in the lot off to the east.

rooms.Name: Outside the Church
rooms.Description:
You stand outside the church.  There is a wedding reception going on, and
lots of corny people are standing around and singing.  There's a car parked
in front of the church, and on the side is painted "She got hers, now he'll
get his."  What cheezeballs...

rooms.Name: Inside the Church
rooms.Description:
So lets go see the man who began it (he's in the casket!) when we met in his
science exam(it)...made me...give you the eye and then panic.  This is a
fairly ordinary church, except for the transvestites posing as decons and
church officials.

rooms.Name: Denny's Restauraunt
rooms.Description:
The neon signs...Moons over Mi-Hammy...the Grand Slam breakfast.  This is
paradise without a doubt.  Where else can you get coffee, eggs, and cheerful
service 24 hours a day?  So, come in my friends.

rooms.Name: The Smoking Section
rooms.Description:
This is the smoking section.  All the various freaks from Rocky Horror
Picture Show hang out here after the show.  None of them bother to order
anything, they just sit there drinking water and tormenting the other
patrons.  Is there any other way???

rooms.Name: The Cashier's Stand
rooms.Description:
This is where you come to get seated, and get seated you will...as long
as you're not one of the thousands of types of people that Denny's has
decided it doesn't like!

rooms.Name: The non-smoking Section
rooms.Description:
There air here is almost thin enough that you can breath.  This is a far
cry from the smoking section and all its assorted freaks.  Here, you have
all kinds of urban-trash sitting here enjoying their $$1.99 specials.

rooms.Name: The Back of the Kitchen
rooms.Description:
This area is absolutely nasty!  There are various scraps laying all over
the floor, and lots of food is burning on the grill.  After seeing this,
you're SURE you never want to eat at Lenny's...I mean Denny's...again!

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Kitchen
rooms.Description:
This is where the waitresses come to place the orders...that is if they
don't forget to do it!  There are several cooks around, most of them
wearing nose rings and having jet black hair.  Oh well, ass long
as they don't spit on your food...

rooms.Name: The Unisex Bathroom
rooms.Description:
Welcome to Denny's bathroom.  We want your experience to be pleasant, so
please let us know if anything is not up to your standards.  Please don't
mind the drunk in the corner.

rooms.Name: a Dark and Narrow Path
rooms.Description:
You've stepped north on to a small and narrow trail...if you can even call
it that.  It's really just some grass and such that's been trampled down
by several people passing to the north.

rooms.Name: Along the Path
rooms.Description:
The trail seems to become a little wider here, with trees having obviously
been cut to make passage easier.  There's no noticeable traffic here, but
it's obvious to you that someone came this way not too long ago.

rooms.Name: a Steep Slope
rooms.Description:
The path you're on heads sharply downhill at this point.  You have to hold
on to the tree branches on either side of you to prevent yourself from 
falling as you make your way.

rooms.Name: In the Vines
rooms.Description:
The foliage seems to get much thicker here.  Either whoever comes this
way didn't bother to cut these branches down, or they're trying to hide
something.  Either way, you should probably turn back.

rooms.Name: The Clearing
rooms.Description:
You stand in a large clearing, where you notice all the surrounding trees
have been cut down.  The ground is trampled smooth, and you think that you
can hear faint chanting coming from the north.

rooms.Name: In Front of the Large Stone Compound
rooms.Description:
You are on the north side of the clearing, and a large stone compound sits
here.  There are massive iron doors on it, with the letters "BZ" engraved
in gold and silver.  Something on the guards' faces tells you you don't
seem to belong here!

rooms.Name: The Southwest Corner
rooms.Description:
This is the southwest corner of the compound.  There are several worshippers
here chanting and singing.  They seem to be in an almost trace-like state,
blindly devoted to their leader.

rooms.Name: Inside the Compound
rooms.Description:
You step inside, and suddenly are overwhelmed by the smell of incense.  You
notice worshippers all around you, praying to their leader.  A small sign
on the wall informs you that you have entered the compound of the Branch
Zooropean cult.  If you're not a member, you best leave!

rooms.Name: The Prayer Nook
rooms.Description:
There are several mats spread on the floor here, and several cult members 
are sitting on them praying.  They seem to be chanting "zooooo....zooooo"
or some such silly thing.

rooms.Name: The Armory
rooms.Description:
This is the armory of the Branch Zooropean cult.  What would a cult be if
it wasn't heavily armed?  In the future, when enough donations have been
collected, this will be where the stockpile of arms sits.

rooms.Name: The Sacrificial Altar
rooms.Description:
This is where the members of the cult come to dispose of their victems. 
Here, they offer them up to the skies, so that Zooropa shall be pleased.
If you don't leave soon, you may be next!

rooms.Name: The Donation Room
rooms.Description:
In the not too distant future, this will be where you will be expected
to donate 10% of your income to the cult.  By dropping your money here, it
will go into the cult's treasury.  It will be used for the betterment of
cult members.

rooms.Name: The High Priest's Room
rooms.Description:
This is where the high priest of the Branch Zooropeans celebrates.  He
or she is devinely chosen by Zooropa himself to do his work on the mud.
If you're coming in here, you'd better have a darn good reason!

rooms.Name: Frank's Pleasure Suite
rooms.Description:
Scattered all around this room are various instruments which Dr. Frank N.
Furter uses to create his "toys."  Hey...what's that over in the corner?  It
looks like some sort of interplanetary transport device...you mean...he's
going to send you to another planet?  Planet, Schmanet, Janet...

rooms.Name: A Large Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a large dark cave.  This is perhaps the most
frightening place you've ever been!  Flee now while you still can!  You
would be lucky to escape from here alive!

rooms.Name: End of Hallway
rooms.Description:
You are at the pitch black end of the hallway.  You have never felt such
immense fear in all of your life.  Turn back now when you still can!

rooms.Name: Hallway
rooms.Description:
It's even darker this far north.  You feel immense danger from the north
which causes you to shiver to the bone.  I'd seriously reconsider this if
I was you!

rooms.Name: Hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in a large hallway leading north.  To the north, it seems to get
darker and darker.  Something tells you you'd better be pretty darn
prepared if you intend to head north!

rooms.Name: The Swimming Pool
rooms.Description:
You've fallen into the large swimming pool in the middle of the theatre.
The water is crystal-clear, except for the transvestites and assorted
fruit loops floating in it.

rooms.Name: Frank N. Furter's Theatre
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a cavernous auditorium filled with ex-celebs who
must have done something really bad to get forced to sit through this
floor show.  Below the stage you see a large swimming pool with a Greek
mosaic on the bottom.

rooms.Name: End of a Long Hallway
rooms.Description:
You have come to the far eastern end of the long east-west hallway.  Fear
grips you as you consider going any farther to the east.  Entering the
movie theatre could be one of the most frightening things you have ever
done!

rooms.Name: The Hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in a long and narrow east to west hallway.  To the west you see the
door leading into Frank's central reception hall and ballroom.  You only
wonder what kind of indecent things lie further east.

rooms.Name: The Red Bedroom
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a bedroom with a slight rose tint to it.  There's
a large canopy bed in the middle of the room and lots of giggling is
coming from under the covers.  Something about this room just makes your
skin crawl.

rooms.Name: The Blue Bedroom
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a room with a faint blue hue.  All around you is
darkness except for the blue light above the large canopy bed in the 
centre of the room.  What Frank does in this room is something you
really don't care to know!

rooms.Name: Behind the Stage
rooms.Description:
You stand next to a globe behind the stage.  Looks like this area has been
used several times for Frank's less wholesome hobbies.  It makes you want
to take Charles Atlas by the....hand.  In just seven days, he can make you
a man!

Exits.Description: A heavy Iron door is blocking your way.

rooms.Name: Balcony Above Frank's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
You stand on the large circular balcony above Frank's laboratory.  Frank
is below showing off his creation to Brad and Janet.  Standing among all
these transvestites makes you feel a bit creepy and out of place.

rooms.Name: Behind the Tank
rooms.Description:
You are behind the large glass tank which Rocky Horror appeared from.
On the floor you see Rocky Horror -- he looks hurt.  Did THEY do this
to him?  They sure did!  Good thing Janet's bandaged his wounds with
torn shreads of her slip.

rooms.Name: The Walk-In Freezer
rooms.Description:
You have entered a large walk in freezer.  The stench in here is almost
unbearable.  It almost smells like rotting human flesh.  You have an urge
to throw up and run out of this room as soon as possible!

rooms.Name: Frank N. Furter's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a serile room which resembles an operating room.
At the far north end of the room is Frank N. Furter dressed in green
surgical garb.  A large balcony surrounds the room, and it is filled
with a gaggle of unconventional conventionists.  To the north is a large
tank of water and to the west is a large freezer.

rooms.Name: The Elevator
rooms.Description:
You are in a small metal elevator with Riff-Raff and Columbia.  Looks
like you have to go up.  You can just pull out the aces when the time
is right.

rooms.Name: On the Stage
rooms.Description:
You have stepped onto the large stage in Frank's ballroom.  You see him
perched on his plush vinal chair and grinning at you.  Coloumbia is
to his left and Magenta is on the right.  All the unconventional
conventionalists are standing around cheering Frank's rendition of
"Sweet Transvestite."

Exits.Description:
A heavy iron door is here hidden behind the satin curtains.  Looks like
you'll need a very special key for this one!

rooms.Name: Aisle to a stage
rooms.Description:
You're in the middle of a large ballroom.  All around you stand a
myriad assortment of transsexuals and generally odd people.  Ahead of
you you see a raised stage.

rooms.Name: Aisle to a stage
rooms.Description:
You stand in an aisle in the middle of a large ballroom.  You feel
cold, wet, and just plain scared!  The aisle continues to the east.

rooms.Name: The door to the ballroom
rooms.Description:
You have opened the door into a rather large ballroom.  All around you
are a myriad assortment of transsexuals and aliens.  You're frightened,
but something about this place intrigues you!

rooms.Name: The Foyer
rooms.Description:
You've stepped into the foyer of a large castle.  You look around and
can't help but wonder "What kind of a Place is this?  It must be some kind
of hunting lodge for rich weirdos."  (yeah rich weirdos!)  Everything
around you is dusty, including the transvestite perched on the banister!

Exits.Description: Yup, it's still the door you entered through.

rooms.Name: The door to the castle
rooms.Description:
Riff-Raff has opened the door to Frank N. Furter's castle.  He gives
you a quick "hello" before the lightning outside reveals a row of Harley
Davidsons.  Oops...weren't supposed to see that!  I think perhaps you'd
better.....come inside.
